experience.title: Manager

experience.title: Manager- Innovative Finance
experience.description: Worked on diverse set of projects that aims to identify Blended Finance mechanism to unlock working capital for early stage social enterprises and large nonprofit organisations; ultimately helping in scaling business operations and demonstrate impact at scale. -Included rigorous research into the business operations and financial positions of the social enterprises and nonprofit organisations-Included engagement with a diverse set of financiers to understand their risk appetite, sector preferences and outlook, and willingness to collaborate with different breed of financiers to solve a specific set of market failure-Included synthesizing the growing field of research on blended and innovative mechanism to support enterprises and projects that aim at solving a specific set of market failure

experience.title: Senior Manager

experience.company: Centre for Social Impact and Philanthropy

experience.title: Development Consultant
experience.description: Engaged with 10+ social impact organizations and provided professional services in the area of program strategy, philanthropy advisory, fundraising strategy and communications. The social impact organizations largely worked in the domain of quality education, physical education, access to higher education, rural development, disaster management and grant-making.

The social impact organizations largely worked in the domain of quality education, physical education, access to higher education, rural development, disaster management and grant-making. <!---->

experience.title: Senior Program Leader (Donor Management)
experience.description: I was working as an fundraising and client relationship management associate with an additional role of an executive assistant to the Director of Partnerships and Finance. Broadly, I was responsible to assist the senior leadership of Kaivalya Education Foundation to strategically raise funds for scaling up programs of the organisation by conducting thorough research on potential donors, drafting sharp project proposals, collaborating with on-ground teams, human resource team and finance team to design a program budget that fits the project need and donor's pocket. Being a part of the relationship management team, I assisted in developing a 5-year fundraising strategy for the organisation considering its growth strategy. As the organisation was growing, being a part of the fundraising team, I had an opportunity to design a hiring process and onboard talented associates who could take charge of donor compliances and internal stakeholder management. My best project in this tenure was onboarding Development Impact Bond (DIB) for the organisation. It included collaborating with multiple third party organisations (group of funding agencies, management consulting firm, specialist organisation, media houses, etc.). DIB being a novel mechanism of social financing, I was given the responsibility to disseminate the knowledge on DIB to internal stakeholders (on-ground team, finance team, HR Team, Marketing team, Assessment team, Fundraising team) of the organisation.

experience.title: Gandhi Fellow
experience.description: Gandhi Fellowship is a 2-year youth leadership development program where a fellow directly engages with country's public education system with an aim to develop leadership abilities of key stakeholders, improve service delivery processes and therefore improve learning outcomes in public schools. I along with 7 more fellow colleagues were responsible to improve quality of education in over 40 public/government schools in a remote block of Udaipur district. Primary responsibilities include understanding needs of the each unit of school, planning out areas of intervention, engaging with school heads and teachers for leadership development and improving teaching skills and mobilising communities to execute change initiatives.

recommendations: Akash Sain “Pramit is a highly intelligent impact professional who puts in rigor, creativity and curiosity to achieve his goals. I have worked with him in Piramal Foundation and he has been phenomenal in his role to manage donor relations. His top skills are finance managent, donor relationship management and project managent. ”

Riyanka Roy “I came to know Pramit back in 2014, when we both joined Gandhi Fellowship & were placed in the outskirts of Udaipur to work directly with the Headmasters in Government Schools. Being a person brimming with ideas related to social development & a strong educational background of economics, Pramit also stood out with achievable solutions and has always been a great team player. His easy-going nature, ability to convince & motivate others are mention-worthy and he's quite capable of being a great leader, supporting & encouraging everyone for growth. Over the years, I've seen him hone his skills in different work areas related to program strategy, philanthropy advisory, fundraising strategy, and communications. His passion for work quite literally sums up everything and I'm quite sure of his potentials to achieve greater heights in the years to come.”
